file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-40-13-07 - EWIS COMPONENTS IN THE FOWARD FUSELAGE II (LATERAL SIDE) - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EWIS COMPONENTS IN THE FOWARD FUSELAGE II (LATERAL SIDE) - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to clean the EWIS components of forward fuselage II, on the cockpit side and at the forward pressure bulkhead. B. Related Zones: 221/222/223/224. C. Zone Boundaries (AMM MPP 06-41-00/100 AMM MPP 06-41-00/100) . D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY EWIS COMPONENTS IN FORWARD FU- ALL 05-40-13-100-801-A ♦ SELAGE II - CLEANING EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 05-40-13 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-40-13-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. EWIS COMPONENTS IN FORWARD FUSELAGE II - CLEANING A. General (1) This procedure obeys the EWIS ICA requirement. (2) This task gives the instructions to do SMRD Task Number: 20-00-00-140-010-A00. (3) You must clean the EWIS components of forward fuselage II, in zones 221/222/223/224. (4) Do not unlace or displace the electrical wirings and components during the cleaning procedure. (5) Do not disconnect the electrical connectors during cleaning procedures. If you find contamination, clean only the exposed areas. (6) Refer to the preparation subtask for access panel information. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-12-05-000-801-A/400 LH AFT CONSOLE - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-12-05-400-801-A/400 LH AFT CONSOLE - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-12-06-000-801-A/400 PEDAL ASSEMBLY LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-12-06-400-801-A/400 PEDAL ASSEMBLY LINING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-12-08-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-12-08-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-12-09-000-801-A/400 LH/RH COCKPIT LINING - REMOVAL AMM TASK 25-12-09-400-801-A/400 LH/RH COCKPIT LINING - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-803-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-803-A/400 - AMM TASK 31-11-01-000-801-A/400 MAIN INSTRUMENT PANEL - REMOVAL AMM TASK 31-11-01-400-801-A/400 MAIN INSTRUMENT PANEL - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 31-12-01-000-801-A/400 GLARESHIELD PANEL - REMOVAL AMM TASK 31-12-01-400-801-A/400 GLARESHIELD PANEL - INSTALLATION WM 20-21-00 - EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 05-40-13 Page 2 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Standard Vacuum cleaner To clean the area Commercially Cloth, Lint-Free To clean the area AR available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 05-40-13 Page 3 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward fuselage II - cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the pilot and copilot seats (AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove pedal assembly linings 223HZ and 224HZ ( AMM TASK 25-12-06-000-801-A/ 400). (3) NOTE: Remove LH aft console 223LZ maintenance panel to make the 223ELW cockpit internal panel installation easier ( AMM TASK 25-12-05-000-801-A/ 400). Remove LH/RH complement consoles 223ELW and 224ERW (AMM TASK 25-12-08-000-801-A/400) . (4) Remove LH/RH cockpit linings 223DLW, 223CLW, 224CRW ,and 224DRW( AMM TASK 25-12-09-000-801-A/400) . (5) Open access panels 223FLW, 223KLW, 223JLW, 223MZ, 223UZ, 224KRW, 224JRW, 224FRW, 224MZ, and 224NZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100) . (6) Remove glareshield panel 223AZ ( AMM TASK 31-12-01-000-801-A/400). (7) Remove main instrument panel 223BZ ( AMM TASK 31-11-01-000-801-A/400). (8) Remove thermoacoustic insulation pads, in zones 221/222/223/224 (AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-801-A/400, AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-802-A/400 or AMM TASK 25-81-01-000-803-A/400, as applicable). J. EWIS Components in Forward Fuselage II - Cleaning (Figure 701) (Figure 702) (Figure 703) SUBTASK 100-002-A (1) The cleaning procedure of this task is applicable to the EWIS components in zones 221/222/223/224. (2) Do the cleaning procedure as follows: (a) Use a vacuum cleaner and/or clean and dry cloth to remove the particles from the EWIS components in forward fuselage II, on the cockpit sides and at the region above the floor line of the forward pressure bulkhead. (b) If contamination is found, clean the EWIS components. Refer to WM 20-21-00, "Cleaning Procedures" Section. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 05-40-13 Page 4 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (1) Install the thermoacoustic insulation pads previously removed in zones 221/222/223/224 (AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-801-A/400, AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-802-A/400 or AMM TASK 25-81-01-400-803-A/400, as applicable). (2) Close access panels 223FLW, 223KLW, 223JLW, 223MZ, 223UZ, 224KRW, 224JRW, 224FRW, 224MZ, and 224NZ ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (3) Install glareshield panel 223AZ ( AMM TASK 31-12-01-400-801-A/400). (4) Install main instrument panel 223BZ ( AMM TASK 31-11-01-400-801-A/400). (5) Install LH/RH cockpit linings 223DLW, 223CLW, 224CRW, and 224DRW ( AMM TASK 25-12-09-400-801-A/400). (6) Install LH/RH complement consoles 223ELW and 224ERW (AMM TASK 25-12-08-400-801-A/400). (7) Install LH aft console 223LZ ( AMM TASK 25-12-05-400-801-A/400). (8) Install pedal assembly linings 223HZ and 224HZ ( AMM TASK 25-12-06-400-801-A/ 400). (9) Install the pilot and copilot seats (AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 05-40-13 Page 5 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
